body: As the dialogue says, you should regenerate it.

> As the dialogue says, you should regenerate it.

Shouldnt that be instructed from zap as well (link,video..) if not fixed through an update?

The dialog in your screenshot (from ZAP) instructs you to regenerate it. It isn't fixed via update because it's unique to every install.

Instructions are here: https://www.zaproxy.org/docs/desktop/ui/dialogs/options/dynsslcert/ and also in ZAP's help if you need them.

At least make it clear to the user how to generate the certificate at the first place (in that wiki it only show how to import/install it within firefox unless i missed that): 

Here are some screenshots might be useful to use: (you can change the text to whatever you like)

- Open zaproxy go to Tools -> Options..

![ca1](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/11895339/127384813-1b8c5c7a-f148-442f-b574-170bf81eec39.png)

- On the left side scroll down to Dynamic SSL certificate

![ca2](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/11895339/127385041-6c7824a7-d1c5-45a5-900c-ecf0010ba9b2.png)

- Generate new certificate and if you press on view it will show you the certificate details: 

![ca3](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/11895339/127385235-ef4f242b-9869-42f0-b0ba-c0d449e2e195.png)

(you can add this image to https://www.zaproxy.org/docs/desktop/ui/dialogs/options/dynsslcert/#generate)

- Close certificate details and press on save

(the rest of the wiki explain how to import the certificate)

I would not have a problem with a "Regenerate Now" button (or similar) on that dialog which opens up the relevant dialog - that way a user will be in the right place to export the cert.
Thoughts @thc202 @kingthorin ?

rename.from: ZAPs Root CA certificate has expired
rename.to: Allow to regenerate expired certificate from warning dialogue

body: Title updated accordingly (feel free to tweak).

issue.title: Root CA expired but regenerated root CA not used by OWASP ZAP

repository.name: zaproxy
repository.description: The ZAP by Checkmarx Core project

issue.body:
I started 2.10.0, it correctly reported the Root CA had expired.
I generated a Root CA in the Dynamic SSL settings. I saved this to a file and imported to browser.
OWASP ZAP was using old Root CA, so restarted OWASP ZAP and it is still using the expired CA Cert.

This is on Debian, I appear to have installed OWASP ZAP by tar ball to "~/ZAP" originally, and then installed via packaging tool to /usr/share/zaproxy. But otherwise fairly vanilla install.

I resolved it by renaming "~/.ZAP" to "~/.ZAP.OLD", when everything started working as expected, but obviously a lot of other configuration is potentially "lost" (Probably for the better in this instance but others may be more frustrated by such an issue). The installation was August 12 2020. I still have the ".ZAP.OLD" (for now).

issue.title: Add option to recreate root cert on expired warning

repository.name: zaproxy
repository.description: The ZAP by Checkmarx Core project
